featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely ridiculous behaviour from the staff. It's 9:20pm. I ordered online ahead of time as I was coming in car from home to eat in. Had to go to washroom first as I have some health issues and needed to wash my hands before I eat. As normally ppl should. Staff didn't want to let me in with an excuse that the maintenance is in progress. No one was doing maintenance they just simply decided to close to the washroom for the night. This kind of behaviour should be illegal as it is a restaurant and restaurant bylaw says clearly you need to provide washroom when ppl eat in. Hope they will not behave like this towards anyone else in the future. Managers name that night was Jenny. Hope the top management will sort this out. I will visit again to see if the behaviour towards customers improved. Then will revisit my review.

Expensive location -- 30c to $1 more expensive for most items.  Go to the Kingsway/Victoria location if you can, it's a bit cheaper.

On top of being one of the most expensive locations in the city this one's also one of the worst.  They clear off all orders from their pick up screen making for a confused, full lobby of everyone asking if their order is up.  Use the system as it's meant to be and things would be a lot clearer and run more smoothly!

Somehow, this location also has the worst McIced coffee ever.

featured_reviews.review_id:
There's typically enough parking available. The upstairs seating area offers plenty of space, making it a great spot for families or groups. The food quality consistently meets my expectations, and the service is reliable. The availability of kiosks is a convenient touch, especially during busy hours.

However, there are some downsides to consider. The downstairs seating area is quite limited, which can be a drawback during crowded periods. It's also worth noting that the upstairs area may close at night, limiting your options for seating. Lastly, be prepared for potential wait times, as occasionally, there can be delays in receiving your order.

In summary, this McDonald's location is a dependable choice with a few minor inconveniences. If you value parking availability, good food, and a variety of seating options, it's worth a visit, just be mindful of potential wait times and seating restrictions.

featured_reviews.review_id: This has to be the worst McDonald's I've been to. This is not a one-time deal; they're the nearest McDonald's and as a busy student on a budget I end up here once in a while. No matter what time of day, even if they aren't busy, you'll end up getting parked to wait for your food when going through drive thru, even for a small, basic order, and sometimes end up sitting for upwards of 10 minutes. "Fast food", woo! There's never any greeting at the drive thru mic, you drive up and sit there waiting for several minutes without so much as a "hello" or "be right with you". Today, I received two "sausage" egg McMuffins with no sausage on either. Great... to summarize: terrible, slow, inaccurate, impolite and no end in sight. Not to mention their nightmare of a parking lot.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We are working on a jobsite nearby, occasionally stop for coffee or breakfast in the morning, not once has my order been correct.

This morning I ordered a sausage and egg mcgridle, they gave me two of the mcgriddle buns with a jr chicken patty inside.

The employees running the drive thru window are consistently snarky, with the main focus of getting you in and out of the drive-thru as fast as possible, regardless if your order is right.

When I did bring up an issue with the order the one morning, I was told it's my fault she couldn't hear me clear enough, and to speak up next time.

One of the worst McDonald's locations in the metro Vancouver area, and the owner does not care due to the influx of knight street traffic and airport location.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Slow clap for this location

Food is typical for McDonald's.

Service, we'll this location is horrible, everytime I come here I get told to park and wait for my order. A fry burger and a pop. How sad it is that they cannot have enough food ready to go. I understand that demand is higher at certain times but 25 minutes from order to getting food is ridiculous. And when you refuse to be parked you get even worse service because now you are going against the normal, it's a drive thru and I should have to pull over and wait. While I sat and waited for my order 6 to 7 vehicles were parked so they can make their time for drive thru.  Truly terrible management for thinking this is acceptable to treat customers like this.

After receiving my order my fry level is laughable. Ordered junior McChicken extra mayo and received my mcchicken with no mayo

How do you mess that up.
Completely unacceptable.

Corporate McDonald's needs to review this location and it's management for customer service and drive thru operations.

featured_reviews.review_id: Horrible service here. I ordered 20 nuggets, 3 honey sauce, spicy habanero sauce, quarter pounder with NO onions and EXTRA pickles, and a medium root beer. First of all my friends and I have to wait nearly 40 minutes for our order and when I kept asking them whether or not they're making it the staff kept saying they were working on it but we wouldn't get our food. Then I find out that they gave SOMEONE ELSE our order without double checking the other person's receipt on whether or not it was the correct order. Then after asking them 5 times to make ours they only give us 17 nuggets, 2 honey sauce, spicy habanero sauce, and did not take out the onions from the burger. Also did not receive our root beer and the staff would just ignore us when we would ask politely. My friend is deathly allergic to onions too so she wasn't able to have her burger. I understand it was crowded but that is no way to go about our order. Horrible customer service and I'm very disappointed by this location. They also refused us a refund for not giving us our full order. Terrible place and I will never come back here.

featured_reviews.review_id:
During my recent visit to McDonald's in Vancouver, I had a mixed experience encompassing both positive and negative aspects. Here's a balanced review highlighting the key points:

Positive:
Menu Variety - McDonald's offers a diverse menu with plenty of options. Whether it was classic favourites or new additions, there were choices to suit different preferences and dietary restrictions.

Negative:
Slow Service - This particular McDonald's service could have been faster. It took longer than expected to place my order and receive my food. Improved efficiency during peak hours would enhance the overall dining experience.

Negative:
Atmosphere Concerns - The atmosphere of the restaurant fell short of expectations. The seating area appeared unclean, and the floors were scattered with food and drink spills. This lack of cleanliness created an unhealthy and uninviting environment.

Positive:
Familiarity and Convenience - McDonald's consistency in its menu and service can be comforting for customers seeking a familiar dining experience. Additionally, its convenient locations make it easily accessible for a quick meal.

In conclusion, my visit to McDonald's in Vancouver had ups and downs. While the menu variety and familiarity were positive, the slow service and cleanliness issues detracted from the overall experience. I hope the management takes note of these concerns and takes steps to improve service efficiency and maintain a cleaner and more inviting environment for customers.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Grabbed a game day Big Mac deal here. It was freshly made and for $3, a great deal!

I have been to this McDonald's for decades, going back to its original location on Hastings and Alpha. This "newer" location is smaller, but has a more modern atmosphere.

Staff are courteous, efficient, and patient. Drive thru and in-restaurant ordering experiences were always positive.

Parking is plenty, but due to the elongated space, you're a little further away a lot of times.

Food-wise, due to traffic volume, is more often fresh than not. Besides the Still Creek location, I find this location one of the more reliable McDonald's for consistent fresh quality food.

Great spot to pop in if you're hungry for McDonald's!

Asked to change the hot fries with no salt and complained I had been waiting for my food over 30 mins.  The manager gave an attitude, "it is not my problem, we were busy", I said "so is that my problem? you are the manager on duty and not responsible the human power?" There is nothing to do with human right but I was not treated right.  I brought it up to McDonald Headquarter about the incident I experienced at this location and asked for refund coz I threw them away.  The headquarter told me this restaurant manager would contact me within 10 business days but I never receive any phone call or email.  I received 2 meal coupons from Headquarter as a refund.  I will never ever come back again.  P.S. This restaurant is always full of garbage everywhere and no one was doing cleaning.

The manager gave an attitude, "it is not my problem, we were busy", I said "so is that my problem? you are the manager on duty and not responsible the human power?"  She turned around and shout "it's not my problem, give her something hot".  I am patience enough to wait more than 30 mins for FAST FOOD and I deserve to receive this kind of "Customer service"????  The manager was trying to hide when I was taking her picture for evidence.  And other manager on duty was trying to cover her and asked me am I using human right.  There is nothing to do with human right but I was not treated right.  I brought it up to McDonald Headquarter about the incident I experienced at this location and asked for refund coz I threw them away.  The headquarter told me this restaurant manager would contact me within 10 business days but I never receive any phone call or email.  I received 2 meal coupons from Headquarter as a refund.  I will never ever come back again.  P.S. This restaurant is always full of garbage everywhere and no one was doing cleaning.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I worked here after high school during the 1980's for six years until Expo 86. Ah, the memories. Now I eat here and it's a totally different environment. The restaurant is smaller and the service isn't what it use to be. I had to wait 5 minutes before a crew noticed me standing at the counter. They have to look up often, not at their food station.
The drink station needs a wipe and the floors are sticky. The tables needs clearing and wiped. And floors swept of dropped fries. My whole time eating there not a single time a lot & lobby person checked.
I'll still come back at another time to eat to check if there's any improvements.

Service friendly and supportive, thanks to the staff. Automatic order Machine working fine, order TV screen working as supposed to be.
I think if you're comparing to Alberta all McDonald's in BC working great - I'm still shocked.
If you'll find source of smell and reduce it, big improvement guaranteed. Good place for getting your fast food.

featured_reviews.review_id: Small cafe, very pleasant service, quickly ordered coffee and chicken hamburger, muffins. It's very tasty and positive. The downsides are dirty tables and floors, a lot of garbage and an overflowing trash can right next to the tables, which was not very pleasant. We wiped our own table and sat for quite a long time. At the end of our meeting, workers came and removed everything from the trash can. We may have stopped by during their lunch hour, let's try again. But the kitchen itself was clean and the workers were in clean clothes. We'll come back again, maybe it will be cleaner. In any case, thank you, there was nothing stopping us from sitting and talking over coffee.

It's McDonald's. For when you don't have time to get out of the car and you're okay on spending money on food that is utterly predictable and forgettable, it's one of your only options in this world. Sometimes as a bonus, it will trigger a childhood memory, good or bad.

Anyway, it hasn't killed me yet, so that's something.

This particular McDonald's is not a drive thru, so there's almost no reason to go to it.

And the washrooms are out of order most of the time.

featured_reviews.review_id:
McDonald's has always been a go-to spot for me when I'm craving some good comfort food. The taste and quality of their food consistently great.The atmosphere is pretty chill, whether I'm grabbing a quick bite or hanging out with friends. It's got that classic McDonald's vibe that's both nostalgic.

Now, when it comes to service, it's a bit of slow. Sometimes things run smoothly and the staff is friendly, but there have been a few instances where I've encountered slow service or slight mistakes in my order. That's why I'm giving it a 3-star rating for service.

McDonald's still gets a thumbs up from me. The food and vibe are top-notch, and even with some service hiccups, it's a spot I'll keep coming back to this address

featured_reviews.review_id:
Head offices & Regional Managers
*PAY Attention*

Had to reduce the stars  I frequent this location multiple times a week to check the conditions of this location.

I've worked in this industry for decades and I manage properties. I'm also a safety, and food safety and security inspections officer for multi billion dollar corporations.

Unfortunately, I know when a venue isn't managed properly.

This location is busy, MacDonalds app keeps sending offers to Walmart McDonald's creating congestion and traffic.

This location is frequently understaffed, with a high turnover rate. Resulting in poor quality service, uncleanliness, long wait times, and disgusting, dirty places with flies buzzing everywhere.

The self-serve soda machine and ketchup  dispenser is frequently neglected resulting in a mess, or emptied, or lack of ice. This further causes more congestion as patrons now have to come up to the countertops to request for ketchup, lids , ice or soda.

This location's managers and supervisors need to be on top of this every hour on the hour.

The tables need to be cleaned, especially during rush hours.

Any MacDonald that has flies buzzing around is a result of staff NOT cleaning properly for weeks on end!

Another serious issue is the quality of the oil
*See picture*

The oil is overly burnt and brown or black, it taste that way also and anything coming out of the deep fryer taste disgusting.
I'm fully aware of what is required to clean the oil fryer and how often the oil needs to be changed.

I can tell you this has not been done properly, the oil is over used.  I can tell without even having to visit the kitchen to take a look at the fryer.

Fix these issues before I report this location to authorities.

I'm deeply disappointed by my recent visit to McDonald's, the first-ever in Canada, located at Landsdowne, Richmond. Despite being a loyal customer for years and always ordering two sandwiches with extra butter portions - a practice consistent with requesting ketchup - I was shockingly refused by an employee named Waqas (if I recall the name correctly). He claimed extra butter is only for breakfast hours, despite the fact that it's a standard option on the kiosk, similar to the availability of complimentary ketchup.

Waqas's dismissive and confrontational attitude was disrespectful. He even argued I hadn't paid separately for the butter, using this as a reason to deny it. This experience was disheartening and marred my overall visit.

places.name: Nando's PERi-PERi
places.description: Afro-Portuguese chain restaurant serving flame-grilled chicken in spicy chilli sauce.
places.address: Nando's PERi-PERi, 2064 W 41st Ave, Vancouver, BC V6M 1Y8

featured_reviews.review_id: Went for dinner today and this restaurant exceeded my expectations! The service was great, with attentive staff who were knowledgeable and helpful with providing recommendations. The food was amazing!  The chicken were juicy and flavorful! However, they are still a bit spicy for me even though I ordered plain.  We loved the halloumi cheese and that yummy egg dessert too!!! Plus the cozy ambiance added an extra touch of comfort to the dining experience. Highly recommended!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I recently tried Nando's chicken and rice bowl, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in both taste and service. The chicken was perfectly grilled and seasoned with Nando's signature flavors, offering a delicious and slightly spicy kick. The rice was fluffy and well-cooked, complementing the chicken beautifully.

What truly stood out, though, was the excellent customer service. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and ready to assist with any requests. They made my dining experience even more enjoyable.

Overall, Nando's chicken and rice bowl not only satisfied my taste buds but also left me impressed with their top-notch customer service. I'll definitely be returning for more.

featured_reviews.review_id: Definitely put this restaurant on your list when you're in Canada. I went to this restaurant simply because I am craving for some chicken but surprisingly their food is superb! The chicken flavor is authentic and the variety of their sauces are exquisite, surely a good pair with their grilled chicken. The chicken is moist and the rice is cooked into perfection. The service are over the top, the staff are very hospitable which I enjoyed. Love the overall experience and will definitely come back here again.

featured_reviews.review_id: My family loves this location and we probably bring the kids once a week as a treat. The food is always good quality and the staff are always very friendly and helpful. It's frequently quite busy here and I often see familiar faces of other regulars who must enjoy coming here too.
featured_reviews.review_text: My family loves this location and we probably bring the kids once a week as a treat. The food is always good quality and the staff are always very friendly and helpful. featured_reviews.review_id: My friend and I shared a Beyond Burger meal with sweet potatoes as our fries instead of normal potatoes and added onion rings to the side and root beer for drink. The food overall tasted great! The only thing is the onion rings were too salty... inedibly salty. A staff came by every once in a while and checked to make sure everything was still good and we had everything we wanted. Overall great experience at this A&W. I would 100% recommend coming here for good fast food experience. I should also mention that we came about an hour before they closed and they still treated their customers with a smile on their faces and were happy to serve.

Managers doesn't know how to manage the staff, and can't even do the multi tasking.
We went for breakfast in drivethru and it's Breakfast Rush. I don't why would they position only one ordertaker for 2 DT- lanes. It should never happen! That's why there is 2 lanes, and should have 2 order takers especially in rush hours. I was already in the menu board to place an order but no one is answering so i went directly in the first window to place an order. And the lady staff in the window has the audacity to tell me "why i didn't place the order in advance, it's busy and she's alone doing the order taker''
So i asked her why are you order taking for 2 lines, that shouldn't be happening, but she just told me to tell the manager... I went to tge 2nd window to pick up my order and saw the manager. And she's not even wearing a DT headset, i told her to help and do multi task, manager should know better! And
re-train your staff of proper customer service!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Cravings have me here nearly nightly with the same order. Both last night and tonight the cashier who took the order last night and the manager who was involved for no reason at all tonight were rude as hell. A simple no would do.  I asked to pay for a medium drink and to be given a small drink in it.  As I was trying to explain I would pay for another drink if they would just put ice in it the person taking the order snapped , interrupting me to say that "they need me to hurry up and order as they are busy".
At no point between the person taking the order and the manager barking at us and acting as if I was asking for something for free did they stop to listen or offer a solution. Will continue to visit because the fetus demands it- but wow these folks cannot do customer service and efficiency at the same time.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My recent visit to McDonald's left me a bit disappointed. As a fan of their classic apple pies, I was looking forward to enjoying one with my meal. Unfortunately, to my dismay, they were out of apple pies during my visit. It was quite disappointing as it's a signature item that I always look forward to when visiting McDonald's.

The absence of the apple pie made me reconsider my order, and I ended up getting a refund, which didn't quite hit the spot. I understand that inventory issues can happen, but it's disappointing when a staple item like the apple pie is unavailable.

On the positive side, the rest of the meal was as expected from McDonald's - tasty and satisfying. The service was relatively quick, and the staff was friendly. However, the lack of apple pies did put a damper on the overall experience.

I hope McDonald's takes note of this issue and ensures a more consistent supply of their signature items in the future to avoid similar letdowns for other customers.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I don't usually review a fast food restaurant, but after "Multiple" similar incidents, I have to write it to warn people about this place.  When you order drive in, make sure that you check the order especially if you order more than 2 items, because today marked the fourth time that this chain "FORGOT" to put one of the order and mask it in the pile of other orders in one bag.

My order today: McCrispy Bacon Deluxe meal, 20 McNuggets and Fillet of Fish burger.
They deliberately packed all of the food in one bag and lo and behold when I opened it at home, they "FORGOT" to put the fillet of fish burger.

If this only happens once, I wouldn't think about but this is now my fourth time, losing an order, the items they "FORGOT" in the past, "6 Mcnuggets 2x, another Fish of Fillet"  It seems to me that this becomes a habit whenever the person who did the order is this lady by the name of YASHPREET.  So be careful, when you order more than 2 items, ask for receipts, stay in the parking lot, check your orders then leave, don't let YASHPREET eat your meal because she "FORGOT" to put your small order of burger in your bag.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My fries were cold, the burger was cold and wasn't even assembled well, the patty was halfway on the bun. I can see if it were late at night or busy or understaffed but it was quiet, with at least four staff around 7pm. I don't expect much from fast food but when I'm paying $16 for 2 burgers, fries and a coke I expect it to at least be hot. And ketchup would have been nice considering I specifically asked for it. Worst McDonald's I've been to in a very long time.

*Edit
I have since returned to this McDonald's and have had a much better experience. Maybe that one visit was just an off day or maybe there was a change in management. Whatever the reason, I hate to pigeon hole a place based on 1 visit. I will eat here again as it's close to home, and let you all know how it goes. Upgrading from 1 to 3 stars.

Edit* I ordered a cone which immediately fell apart all over my hands. She grabbed a cup and put it in there and thought that was sufficient. I asked for a new one. She disappeared for a minute anf gave me the same cone in a cup and said it was new. I'm done with this McDonald's. 0 stars

featured_reviews.review_id:
Online Ordering Beware!
Hands down the worst order I've ever received from any McDonald's location, *so far*.

I'm not kidding either, do yourself a favor and don't order takeout delivery from this location. Period. The picture I took of my poutine order should already say it all.

If you want further context, read below:

I ordered a poutine from this location through UberEats. There were no issues with the delivery itself. Opening up my poutine box, I discovered one shoddy, thin layer of gravy on a few hardened, bland fries.
If I had to recount, it only had around 10~ individual fries. To make it worse, it arrived at room temperature, despite how I got my order delivered relatively quickly. (McDonald's location is within 1.5 kilometers away from my location.) In the end, I did get my refund from UberEats (thankfully). Sufficient to say I will not be ordering at this location again...

featured_reviews.review_id:
McDonald's is consistent in there food. I don't shop here much but I love the cheeseburgers and fries with no salt.
Staff are always friendly and fast at the drive thru window. Prices are reasonable.   Great place to take the family for a quick bit to eat.  Great place for the seniors to come and have coffee and socialize.  They have Wheelchair accessible seating.  Wheelchair accessible washrooms and parking.  This location is open 24 hours.  Usually both drive thru lanes are open.  You can order online via Skip the Dishes.  Tables outside as well also wheelchair seating and accessible.
Enjoy!

featured_reviews.review_id: Changes review from a 5. We waited for 15 minutes in the drive through. Ordered through the App. They made us park for 20 minutes and the food was old. They didn't answer their phone at all when we called. It went to an answering machine that that didn't have a voicemail. So disappointing. What happened? My daughter loves it when we go to McDonald's after school  You pretty much know what you're going to get. The drinks are cold and refreshing. We were surprised that they still had plastic straws.  The filet o fish was fresh and tasty but it would have been better with more sauce and the sandwich especially since we asked for it and the fish was dry. We were really looking forward to the  the fries but they did not taste fresh and were cold  Most restaurants have meatless options being that they are the largest fast food chain you would think they would to. We will probably be back soon for ice cream

featured_reviews.review_id:
I am unsure of the purpose of the monitor if I cannot find my order and have to rely on the staff for updates every time. Despite their assurances that it is on its way, I believe that if an order is not ready, it should be displayed on the monitor.

It seems that the orders are removed from the monitor to showcase how quickly they serve customers. However, in reality, there is often a backlog of orders waiting to be fulfilled behind the counter. This raises concerns about the integrity of McDonald's practices.

I am curious whether anyone from McDonald's reads customer reviews and takes them into consideration.

From attached picture, you can see people waiting for their orders while there are only two order on the monitor.

featured_reviews.review_id:
**Update** To everyone who has had a negative experience with this location, please fill out a contact form on the McDonald's app or website and file a complaint. They told me this location is already flagged and on their radar. I took the chance and ordered two breakfast sandwiches today and one of them was wrong, and the other had ZERO sauce. The chicken tasted old. Absolutely disgusting.

Third review since this McDonald's keeps deleting them since they don't like hearing the truth!!

In short:

Always check your order before you leave because they usually mess it up and forget something or give you the wrong item.

The food quality is horrendous and does not meet the franchise standards. You might receive a burger with barely any sauce, bread will be burnt, fries are half full and upside down in the bag, etc.

The facility is usually dirty.

Staff are cranky and never know what they are doing.

I've sent in complaints to McDonald's via Twitter and email and they have responded and told me they will be following up with this location.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I get that McDonald's is fast food. But on about 3 occasions my egg mc muffins have been unedibles. To the point that when I gave it to a coworker they threw it straight in the garbage.

The grease was so bad it was seeping through the wrapper all over the place. I've been to many McDonald's and never seen it this bad on numerous occasions.

Plus coffee is never consistent.

Really hate giving bad reviews but do yourself a favour and get something edible elsewhere.

Staff are nice tho.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Been giving this place quite a few chances but their service is the worst compared to other McDonald's locations I've been at. I understand that they're a fast food chain but it doesn't excuse the fact that their workers seem so unhappy at dealing with their customers.
Multiple times they've missed my orders (e.g. no fries when I ordered a meal with medium fries) and I mostly order takeout so I can't just easily inform them of the missing items. I know I should double check my orders before I leave but there are times when I forget and as a customer we do rely and expect on the servers to give you your correct and complete order.

Lastly, they will close and no longer accept orders 10minutes before closing. I've worked at a fast food place as a teenager and we were required to keep our store open to customers at the last minute. The employee on the counter had to raise her voice to tell us that they will no longer be accepting food orders and that we should leave.

featured_reviews.review_id: Mindy the manager was extremely rude to me when I asked her to unlock the bathroom downstairs. She said go upstairs I said no my mom needs to use the bathroom downstairs. She ignored me. I had to tell her again and I said my mom is handicap she can't go up the stairs she needs the bathroom. She looked at me like "who cares" and her other staff ignored me again. I had to basically tell them to open the door and  when I told Mindy she was rude she started arguing with me and talking to me as if we were in a brawl. Completely unprofessional for a "manager" to act this way! She argued with me and even customers were shaking their head at what she was doing. When someone needs to use the bathroom it should not matter what the reason is. I did not need to explain to her that my mother is handicap and is unable to go up the stairs. I have never been to this location but I do have to say it's one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Mindy needs management skills training. Horrible experience! The best part is when you complain to their upper management they always say "will look into it" and nothing gets fixed or done. Upper management will read this and do absolutely nothing and continue on because that's what McDonald's management do "nothing".

featured_reviews.review_id:
I got an ice cream cone. Instead of swirling the ice cream (how it is traditionally done), the manager did a back and forth motion so it was super skinny. I have never been to a McDonalds that has done that. The ice cream was less than half of what it should be (there were big gaps on both sides of the cone where the ice cream should have been).

The manager's tone could be nicer towards her staff. The staff appeared to be scared of her.

On a positive note, the location was clean.

Every time I order a root beer in the drive-thru, I forget to check it and the syrup is always out. They'll still serve it, but it's always out. Fortunately I checked before leaving the parking lot this time, which means I'm also remembering to review it.

It would honestly be better for them to remove root beer as an option altogether rather than to continue to rip people off. Last thing I'm thinking about when I'm getting 'fast food' is whether or not the staff is doing something as simple as changing the syrup... I'm, beginning to think they're intentionally cutting corners.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This was a laughably bad experience. Came here at about 5:00 in the morning so it wasn't very busy. I simply ordered six chocolate cookies. I went inside and stood at the counter and waited for my order. There's no lineu, there's only one order on the order screen, which was mine. There's nobody at the till, there's a couple cooks in the back mopping and a lady up front mopping. After a few minutes the lady up front sees me and then tells the cooks that there's an order up. The cooks say something I couldn't understandand and disappear around the corner. I assume that they're going to finish baking my cookies. Fresh baked cookies, yay, I mean why else would I be waiting around this long for six cookies? They were in the oven baking. No doubt.

But they weren't. They weren't in the oven baking. After about 7 or 8 minutes another young lady comes out from, I guess the break room, and asked if I've been helped. I'm like "yeah I placed an order a while ago." She looks at the till and then reaches under the counter and grabs me six cookies and hands them to me. And, oh yeah, they weren't chocolate cookies either, they ran out. They were the chocolate chip ones. So I wait around for almost 10 minutes for six cookies, and they weren't even the right ones. The complacency at this McDonald's was unreal. I have to laugh honestly it was so bad it was comical. The girl who came in at the end who actually got me the cookies I will say, was doing her job correctly as far as I can tell..

I decided to get cookies here because I was picking up an Uber eats order. Except they told me I had to cancel the order because the customer ordered things from the evening menu and it was now on the breakfast menu. So I had to text the customer and let them know I can't pick up her order because they can't make it and I'll have to cancel. And I canceled. My question is why does this McDonald's have items on their Uber menu that customers can't order? Every McDonald's I've ordered from will have either breakfast items on the menu or their lunch and evening items on the menu. Fix your Uber menu. This is crazy to me also how someone can be on break and literally know other employee in the restaurant looks at orders or prepares orders. Like don't you have a protocol for like, you know, knowing when orders come in? And getting the customers their food?

featured_reviews.review_id: After the renovations I have never been to such a bad McDonald's in my life. The service is god awful. Always rude and make it seem like you are inconveniencing them. I waited 18 minutes for a Jr chicken and a smoothie. I went up to the counter to ask how long as people who ordered after me were getting their meals and let's be real 18 minutes for two items at McDonald's is beyond ridiculous. Was ignored by several employees. Finally got the attention of one of them and was treated poorly as if I was lying. 20+ minutes for two items is ridiculous. The food was awful, no lettuce, super soggy. This place needs new management immediately as it clearly shows the staff they have now were not trained properly and cannot handle the work load (wasn't busy at all). You go to McDonald's and don't really expect top notch service etc but this was baffling.

Not trying to be a Karen just tired of this service but, it's McDonald's... and it's a block away, I just wish it was better.

featured_reviews.review_id: I went to this Mcdonals around 2pm on a Saturday.  I waited a few mins for anyone to even come to the cash.  This is after the manager told me WAIT! With a hand gesture in a very rude way.  When all I was doing is politely waiting I wasn't even looking around for anyone.  Then I placed my order 1 hamburger and 4 nuggets.  I waited over 10 mins after ordering.  In all it took about 15 mins to get my food when I was the only person in line.  However during that time they put out at least 20 online orders.  Absolutely terrible extremely rude service.  This is the worst service I've received at any McDonald's and by far the longest wait time.  Even when there are 10 people in line I've never waited so long

featured_reviews.review_id:
What can you say about a drive-thru McDonald's at 1:00 am for a couple of medium fries and a chai frappuccino?
I thought the fries were just fine ... My friend thought they were too cold and he wasn't impressed with his drink.
If I had any issue at all it's that you can't tell if the place is open or closed. For sure the restaurant part is closed. The inside is dimly lit. The entrance to the drive-thru is kind of lit but as you follow it'sn arrow path around the back of the building it gets pitch black...  like the entrance to a horror theme park. I was about to drive out and I heard a voice coming from the sign I had passed. Backed up and tried to order but the sound was interrupting intermittently and they asked me to pull up to the cashier to order.
The cashier was accommodating while trying to describe the difference between a whipped frappuccino and a chai frappuccino

featured_reviews.review_id:
Always a hit and miss in this location.
Service sometimes takes too long. Almost seems
like there is only two staff working.

Location is not the best either. Driving in to the entrance of their drive thru is dangerous coming from the main street. And drivers can cut each other off which can  cause traffic. It is also near train tracks so if it happens a train is passing by, you can't hear the order taker and they can't hear you.

I only order coffee here and they always get it wrong. Sometimes less cream. Sometimes less or no sugar.

Its the only location on my way to work so I don't really have a choice but to drop by here. Otherwise, won't visit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Guys, you know you're bad. It takes forever to get your order. Multiple times I've waited 10+ minutes for a big mac meal. The average wait time had to be between 5-10.

I love McDonald's and I'm thankful there is one in the area and this location IS better than no location but it's a tough spot to get to by foot and by car. It's cramped (not really your fault just the space you were given) in the interior and it seems the 3 tables you do have are always dirty.

Under normal circumstances, it would be a one star but you guys were dealt a bad hand.

I'll pay 10% more for the food if you can get the fast back into the food and keep the tables clean.

Still I get a big mac several times a month. Just lovin it.

featured_reviews.review_id:
SEE PICTURE. Seen this at landsdowne alderbridge way location, please no2 mcdonalds get this in your bathrooms so we can use are foot to open door! No one wants to touch the handle after washing your hands it is not sanitary and no napkings are still not provided at Mcdonalds no 2 . LEAVE A LIKE IF YOU AGREE. This NO 2 Mcdonalds makes the absolute worst fries of any mcdonalds ive been to, always undercooked or overcoooked, never fresh taste stale, clearly the staff cooks alot of fries at once and does not throw out after the designated time and also is not cooking the correct time consistently i constantly get like 10 of the fries extremely soft undercooked or a few black burnt. Also they short you on fries . Large fries always is never full to top aswell as medium!  The Oreo mcfleury never has enough icecream,  oreo or amount of extras, burgers are usually cooked well but sometimes after 6pm or night especially quarter pounder, cheeseburgers etc it is undercooked or has no taste.  Breakfast they do well, hashbrowns always fresh however ive notice sausage and egg bread is sometimes burned black or hard maybe adjust the toaster?? The coffee never taste really good i usually get 2 cream one sugar and it taste like nothing. The bathroom is a horrible, extremely heavy door with no automatic button!  literally everyone is touching the same handle to get in and out, disgusting!!  a foot handle would make the difference and is much needed or replace the door you make enough money common guys, or automated door... or at the very least leave paper towel so staff and visitors can at least grab door with handle and throw in a nearby garbage like every other store!!!  so not every is touching the same thing, disgusting to think staff touch that then go make your food and visitors touch that when leaving bathroom and go eat there food. Serious  health concern! Or if all that is too expensive leave the door open during shifts with a piece of wood or something under it.  Also Only one toilet  in such a huge restaurant bathroom?? Needs a major renovation. Been like this for atlest 10 years. On a positive note staff are friendly and do work fast. Hope they put some papertowel in bathroom to grab when leaving the bathroom soon, or leave mens door open so you dont have to touch that handle and open that heavy door! Or make it automatic like the main entrance door which is very nice. ALSO been told at drivethrough the park on side and no one was even waiting behind me?? Had 2 items. Why have drive through if u make us wait? Seen others make this point to. Hope this review makes a difference. Leave a like if you agree with my points.

SUMMARY
Pls improve! Manager owner. We understand that new people are hired everyday but other Mcdonalds do not have this problem, have them trained properly.

COOK FRIES PROPERLY WITH PROPER AMOUNT OF FRIES GIVEN CONSISTENLY WITH SALT! cook burgers so they are well done lil burn on em not under cooked with proper seasoning. Dont burn buns on breakfast sausage and egg.

FIX BATHROOM PLS, offer paper towels to use to exit after washing hands and put garbage near to throw away, not just hand drier as everyone touches same handle and alot of people do not wash there hands!  or leave door open permanently with a wood stopper, or add automatic sensor to open door or replace door. Add another toilet, one toilet for a 60 seating restaurant is not enough. Renovate bathroom.

Do not tell drivers to park on side when it is not busy. We go to drivethroughs cuz we are in a hurry. Add more staff to night shift food is always cold and not fresh especially fries and wait times are up to 40 min. HIRE MORE STAFF FOR NIGHT SHIFT.

Oreo mcfleury fill to top with ice cream and use more oreo or smarties etc not giving enough quantity .

Improve coffee. Make sure to put what we order. 2 creams and 1 sugar, shouldnt taste like no sugar or no cream.

Thanks for listening and hope to see improvements in the coming week! Thank you staff and managers!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I wanted to have a quick late night snack last night. Order simplely two item double fliet with no tartar sauce. And sausage egg Mcmiffin. Simple right? Guess it is too difficult for No2 McDonald.

On my bill (shows on the picture), clear says double filet and been charge for it. This happens many time already. Would the staff recheck the order before put in the bag?

On the other item, I clearly says Sausage egg, even the staff took the order repeat back as Sausage egg. But then yet still put in the wrong order with no egg. Oh well, a least I didn't get charge for it. But the muffin is dry and old and burn like the picture show.

Two simple item. Two mistake and trash and burn food quality. Come on No2 McDonald. I see many one star on your review mainly complain about food quality. And yet the management never reply or common any one of them and never show any improvement. And come on, staff, if you are not capable to check if the right order is been order and put in the bag, and keep up the food quailty in the fast food restaurant, I don't know what other job you can do.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Arguably one of the better operated McDonald's! Foods come out hot, quick turnover that means, and well trained staffs!
It's our go to in the morning before church on Sunday and course kids love happy meals.

However franchise should focus on fair pricing as a fast food rather than returning capital to investors, and growing margin profile YoY.  Once it becomes higher price than a regular food, it won't last.

Chicken Mcmuffin was an interesting one! Mcflurry is so addictive.

Hah! Guess you have the rights to enforce those prices.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Finally decided to give McDonalds a try again after a long time. Shamrock shake was available, had to try it!

Ordered a Large Fries. Got a barely filled box. Extremely disappointed.

No idea how the standard of McDonalds has dropped so much.

It gets worse. I asked for no salt in my fries, the fries came salted, soggy and cold.

The quarter pounder with cheese just looks so sad. A few silvers of onion, two wilted pickles, and a non-toasted, squishy bun that feels like a sponge.

The sadness radiating from the meal is so strong, I needed to mentally prepare myself before taking a bite.

Would not recommend this location. The staff clearly don't care about how the food is prepared.

The aforementioned "junior chicken" turned out to be a ruse of the egg and cheese variety. Now I know sometimes things get lost in translation over those headsets but at no point in time could I have possibly asked for a cheese burger with no patty and and poached egg instead. featured_reviews.review_id:
Unfortunately, I've consistently receive the wrong food items in my recent visits. It's disappointing because I believe in the convenience and familiarity of McDonald's, but this ongoing problem has been a source of frustration. I've received the wrong burger multiple times.

I hope McDonald's can address this issue and improve the accuracy of orders to provide a better customer experience. I'd love to continue enjoying their food without the worry of receiving the wrong order every time."

Eventually, I missed the ferry and had to waste 30 min:) thank you guys!

featured_reviews.review_id: We ordered one large kiwi pineapple banana smoothie and one medium kiwi pineapple banana smoothie, one large fries and a chocolate sundae. End up the fries is in small to medium amount which only filled half of the fries box! Further The two smoothies that we received were in the same size, the large smoothie was still have more than one centimetre before hitting the cup line near the top. When my son talked to the staff asking him to top up the large cup, he grabbed the two smoothies (one large and one medium size), and pour the smoothie out from the medium cup to the large cup to top up the large smoothie! What kind of attitude is that? We are not beggar who ask for free food but have paid full price for what we are entitled to receive from the merchant! When the staff passed the "adjusted" smoothies back to us, the female staff who was standing next to the Asian young staff who was dealing with our request looked surprised by what the Asian staff had done to the cups. This is a terrible customer service experience that we ever experienced at McDonald's. We will never come here again unless the team manager look into this and take appropriate action to a better training to their team! They need to know what is the proper amount of each food items and know what is a proper and respectful way to deal with their customers!

featured_reviews.review_id: Saturday morning, literally 6 staff standing around, more in the kitchen. I ordered on mobile and there had been no move to make my coffee when I came in. A person was actually playing on her phone standing in front of the coffee station. So I guess there was one guy assigned to make the coffee and he was off doing something and needing to get scissors and going back but NO ONE even thought of trying to speed things along by making the coffee. They didn't look like trainees because no one was learning anything. There was a manager on site too! Plus other people in the back and a person sweeping up out front, and yet, no sign of a thought that they could help while there were only a couple of people waiting. Normally it's quite slow to get an order there later in the day but I always figured it was because they were overwhelmed with people and you can see many customers standing around (and at least they are trying and working hard), but in this case, they were not busy. So since no one had started to get the coffee yet, I asked politely if I could get the coffee in my own travel mug please. She answered yes, but with a derisive expression and tone but then didn't take the cup. So found out she was going to pour it in from their disposable cup after and that they don't charge for the cup there (which doesn't matter to me). The other McDonald's I go to has already put up a corporate sign encouraging using your own cup, so I know that while there is a Covid concern, as a company they have already made this change and McDonald's has produced this sign at least a month ago. Anyhow, I said that pouring it in defeats the purpose of trying to reduce waste, so she did bring it over to the area but did not explain it to the ONE GUY that apparently can pour coffee in the place and they still wasted a cup and to really rub it in, he opened up a straw in front of me to stir with completely unnecessarily when they knew I was concerned with waste because I had that conversation with that other woman and she completely couldn't be bothered to pass it on or look after the fact that I had made the request to use my cup directly (no one else was waiting in line). Also, when I told him not to (when I saw him open up the straw package), he continued moving to put it in the coffee even though I was CLEARLY saying no and then I had to really emphasize it, because he just wouldn't stop! SUCH AN UNPLEASANT experience. I am flabbergasted by the lack of any motivation to be competent by this crew. I understand division of labour but this was a huge failure. The other McDonald's that is encouraging travel mugs also gets the entire order done before I even get over to the counter and is friendly and normal, not rude and full of attitude on arrival. At the very least, try to be friendly when you greet someone, especially when they are friendly and happy in the first place, and especially when it was not busy at all! Submitted in the spirit of trying to help because if no one ever said anything, this place would keep having problems.

featured_reviews.review_id:
entrance is in the front walkway and also in the back parking lot. the back parking lot is dangerous a bit since the drive through cars will be crossing the entrance pathway. there is no way to slow cars from crossing in front of you.

this place is a bit clean and has more space since not a lot of people come. staff kind of showed their frustration a little bit in the front so yeah it kinda of affected the mood of the place.

there is outdoor seating but it's very tight. I'm pregnant so it's not too ideal to weave around the picnic tables even though it was good sun outside.

bought mcflurry kitkat but it wasn't mixed properly at all. it wasn't mixed halfway to the bottom. so that one was sad. and it had a big hole in the middle so i was basically getting half of what i paid for

bought fries as well, nothing new. greasy but that's what fries are unfortunately.

good for a stop over place before heading out to walk at the seawall for sure.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I gave a very negative review regarding the quality of the food, the level of customer service at this location about one year ago.

It was warranted.  It was terrible.

For the past 2 months I've been coming back here late at night, everything has changed.   They tell you to wait a few mins for your order but that's because they are cooking it fresher for you.

Even though it seems they are still understaffed at times, the STAFF is putting in the effort to make each and every order the way it should be.  Fresh, hot and with a smile.

Dear owner and managers, I know margins are very low right now but please try to do your best to have enough staff on to help them do their jobs better and also happier.

Keep up the good work and thanks for doing a great job serving your local community!

featured_reviews.review_id:
4 coffees and all of them missing sugars. Thought it was a mistake and the same thing happens for the following 2 days.

Edit on Dec 28, 2021: Still no improvements. My coffee missed sugars and my breakfast sandwich didn't have any cheese.. If it wasn't of the location or coupons, I would not use this McDonalds. Don't take me wrong, I love McDonald's. In fact, I spend hundreds a month at different locations of McDonald's, and I try my best to avoid this location but sometimes it is what it is. And each time I order at this specific location, I end up in disappointment. After the braekfast incident today, I "accidentally" ordered at this location while using the app for my dinner. (I'd drive to Wal-Mart in Twassen to pick up if they are open and have done numerous times) My large fries were half filled, burger doesn't have any ketchups, and my sszechuan burger didn't have any sauce. I prayed that I was dreaming. Because, the only reason I ordered that chicken burger was to try out the new sauce which is even advertised as a "featured item" on the app. I'd love to have a full refund and drive to Twassen to get my proper McDonald's order, which I do not have a high expection to, but what you guys are doing at the Ladner location is, absolutely ridiculous. I really hope this review gets some kind of attention from the employees to make some improvements. If these employees can't even follow the simple guidelines engineered by the headquarter to make burgers in the simplest way in the world, then they probably won't end up anywhere in this world.

and would not leave a review unless I feel like this unacceptable.

featured_reviews.review_id: This incident did not happen to me, but I was shocked to witness and just wanted to share. On Sunday Aug 13th around 7:30pm, I went to this location to get an ice cream. The young lady before me had purchased 4 large size ice coffee and the coffees were placed onto a very soft, poor quality paper tray. Due to the heavy weight, the tray broke in half and the 4 coffees spilled on the ground. The young lady asked the manager if she could get a replacement and have someone to clean up the floor. However....the manager said back to her "can you get the mop from the washroom and clean it up yourself?" The young lady was stunned and overwhelmed that the manager actually told her to go clean up the mess. The manager continues to say that "in here, whoever makes the mess gotta clean up themselves." The young lady was also shocked and said " excuse me, but what?" Seeing the customer unsatisfied, the manager said "okay, you can clean it up and I will tell someone (a worker) to help you."  This left me speech, I have never seen customer service like this anywhere else. This is West Van, I just think this location has ruined the reputation/face of park royal.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Upon my recent venture to the illustrious McDonald's establishment, I regrettably encountered a rather disheartening breakfast burrito experience. Alas, the concoction laid before me was a woeful symphony of excessive eggs, leaving the paltry meat to cower in the shadows. Moreover, perplexingly, the establishment boasted a ladies' lavatory while forsaking the gentlemen's sanctuary, a peculiar oversight indeed.

To exacerbate matters, a stringent 30-minute consumption decree cast a gloomy pall over the proceedings, ostensibly to curtail loitering. While one appreciates a prompt and efficient visit, the imposition of such a constraint marred the otherwise indulgent repast.

Alas, my lamentation does not end there, for the custodians of this establishment demonstrated a regrettable deficiency in the art of hospitality. Customer service, once the cornerstone of culinary endeavors, was but a fleeting wisp of an ideal here, leaving patrons feeling disheartened and undervalued.

featured_reviews.review_id: I ordered no onions for my daughter's cheeseburger for the happy meal. I made no adjustments to my order for my double cheeseburger, but there were none on mine either. I went up to the counter to ask for a side of onions because there were none on the burger I ordered and the STORE MANAGER Samira? said they can't do that because THEY COME WITH THE PATTY? (I know this isn't true). I said okay so you have onions? She said yes. I said okay so why can't I get a side of them and she continued to say because they come with the patty's.. makes no sense, especially if you can get them without. She even asked "how are you going to pay for them?" Like what?! I paid for my burger that was supposed to have them on there already and now I have to pay for them? But I thought I couldn't get a side of onions? So I went and finished my meal, came back and showed her the ingredients on the McDonald's site that say my burger should have come with them. I showed her my receipt that said no onions on the happy meal and mine had no modifications. I said if you can't give me onions on the side then you should have offered to remake my burger. She proceeded to say that they could remake my burger but this was after I ate. I don't know why she couldn't just give me some onions on the side. Small issue, but the terrible customer service and lies are the reason for this review. Not only that but as busy as it was, our patty's were not fresh and the fries were just above luke warm and not fresh either. Nuggets were good. I should have taken photos, but I wasn't thinking of leaving a review until after we ate. If you live in the area, 2725 Barnet Hwy, Coquitlam, BC V3E 1K9 is a much better location to visit. The store manager there is amazing.

featured_reviews.review_id: On Sept 29, 2023 around 6:20pm, I ordered only an extra large coffee,  my order # appeared on the screen above the pick up counter,  but after a minute it disappeared,  so I waited a while to see are they gonna hand me my coffee.  After a couple of minutes my order is still not received,   I decided to tell them my number is not on the screen anymore and my order have not yet received,  the employee didn't even check my order #, just told me "its coming".  So I waited for another 5 minutes and I'm done with my patience and asked a lady wearing a black uniform (I guess it was atleast a supervisor) about my situation,  again she didn't check my order # and asked me rudely "what was in your order",  at that time another employee came over and  looked at my order # and handed me my coffee 10 seconds later,  and it's not hot anymore which means it's prepared for a while already,  but no one cares about it.  Last time I visited this place I waited 15 minutes for the same thing.  This will be my last visit to this Mcdonalds. Terrible customer service,  always seeing them chatting and not focus on orders,  no wonder this place receive a lot of complaints about messing up orders. Luckily there are other Mcdonalds I can order from not far away from this one.

featured_reviews.review_id: Terrible customer service. Yesterday, Aug 15 2023, I went to the drive thru to order a large iced water for my grandmother who was experiencing heat exhaustion and they refused to give out water on a day that it got up to 37! They said they would not give us a cup of iced water unless we made a purchase of an item. Water is a basic human right, especially in the middle of a heat wave. They finally gave her a SMALL cup of water and refused to give any more than that. We have always been customers at this location to purchase food. The customer service has always been terrible but after yesterday we will no longer visit this location. Staff there clearly need to be trained better. Jeez having some compassion at least towards an elderly person.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This McDonald's has been a mainstay for many years, a quick coffee and lunch after braving the crowds next door at Costco.  Service, food, cleanliness, atmosphere, all were consistently McDonald's up until the last month or so.  Food quality has plummeted...had a chicken habanero today, almost inedible.  Bun was burnt and cold, chicken patty was dry and hard, lettuce smelled and tasted stale...all this after having to wait ten minutes, with only one other patron at the counter.

The most positive thing I can say about the young lady who very hurriedly handed me my tray...she was professional, if not friendly...

Last time there a  few weeks back was pretty much a carbon copy.

Not sure if this is the new McDonald's model for 2023 or if this is just the Ottawa Street store, but I cannot force myself to go back.
